name: Vegetarian Pasta Primavera
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook pasta according to package directions until al dente.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute.
Add chopped bell peppers and zucchini, cook for 5 minutes until slightly softened.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes until tomatoes start to burst.
Drain pasta and add to the pan with vegetables. Toss everything together.
Add fresh basil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
Serve hot topped with grated parmesan cheese.

name: Vegan Chickpea Curry
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onions and cook until translucent.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add curry powder, turmeric, and cumin. Stir for 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes until they start to break down.
Add chickpeas and coconut milk. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and let simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

name: Grilled Chicken Salad
steps: Season chicken breast with salt, black pepper, and olive oil.
Grill or pan-sear chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until fully cooked.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips.
Wash and prepare mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, and sliced cucumber.
Combine all vegetables in a large bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, salt, and pepper for dressing.
Toss salad with dressing and top with sliced chicken. Serve immediately.

name: Quinoa Buddha Bowl
steps: Cook quinoa according to package directions (usually 1:2 ratio with water, simmer 15 minutes).
Preheat oven to 400°F. Cut sweet potato into cubes and roast for 20 minutes.
Steam or roast broccoli florets until tender-crisp (about 5-7 minutes).
Drain and rinse chickpeas. Season with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Prepare tahini dressing: mix tahini, lemon juice, water, and salt until smooth.
Arrange quinoa, sweet potato, broccoli, chickpeas, and sliced avocado in bowls.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and serve.

name: Salmon Teriyaki with Rice
steps: Cook rice according to package directions.
Mix soy sauce, honey, minced ginger, and minced garlic in a bowl for teriyaki sauce.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Cook salmon skin-side down for 4-5 minutes.
Flip salmon and cook for another 3-4 minutes until cooked through.
Remove salmon and set aside. In the same pan, add teriyaki sauce.
Dissolve cornstarch in water and add to sauce. Simmer until thickened.
Serve salmon over rice, drizzle with teriyaki sauce, and garnish with sesame seeds and green onions.

name: Vegan Black Bean Tacos
steps: Heat a pan over medium heat. Add a bit of oil and sauté diced onions until soft.
Add minced garlic, cumin, and chili powder. Cook for 1 minute.
Add black beans (drained and rinsed) and mash slightly. Cook for 5 minutes.
Warm corn tortillas in a dry pan or microwave.
Slice avocado and prepare lettuce.
Assemble tacos: black beans, avocado slices, lettuce, and fresh cilantro.
Squeeze lime juice over tacos and serve immediately.

name: Keto Cauliflower Fried Rice
steps: Grate cauliflower using a food processor or grater to create rice-like texture.
Heat sesame oil in a large pan or wok over high heat.
Add diced onions, minced garlic, and minced ginger. Stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add grated cauliflower and stir-fry for 5 minutes until slightly softened.
Push cauliflower to one side, add beaten eggs to the other side and scramble.
Add diced carrots and peas. Stir everything together.
Add soy sauce and continue cooking for 2 minutes. Garnish with green onions and serve.

name: Gluten-Free Banana Bread
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan.
Mash 3 ripe bananas in a large bowl.
Add eggs, honey, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
Add almond flour, baking powder, and cinnamon. Stir until combined.
Fold in chopped walnuts (optional).
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 55-60 minutes until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool before slicing.

name: Mediterranean Stuffed Peppers
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds.
Cook rice according to package directions.
Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté diced onions and minced garlic until fragrant.
Add ground turkey and cook until browned. Season with oregano, salt, and pepper.
Mix cooked rice, ground turkey, and diced tomatoes together.
Stuff bell peppers with the mixture. Top with crumbled feta cheese.
Place in baking dish with a little water. Bake for 30-35 minutes until peppers are tender.

name: Vegan Lentil Soup
steps: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onions, carrots, and celery.
Cook vegetables for 5 minutes until softened.
Add minced garlic, cumin, and paprika. Stir for 1 minute.
Add rinsed lentils, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-35 minutes until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Stir in lemon juice before serving.
Serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh herbs if desired.
